title: Tracking issue for LLVM 6 upgrade

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
An LLVM release candidate for 6.0.0 has been tagged, and despite [not having upgraded to LLVM 5](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/43370) we should start weeding out bugs for LLVM 6!

* https://github.com/alexcrichton/rust/tree/llvm-6
* https://github.com/alexcrichton/llvm/tree/rust-llvm-release-6-0-0
* https://github.com/alexcrichton/compiler-builtins/tree/llvm-60
* https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-rt/tree/rust-llvm-release-6-0-0

test results:

* [Second Travis Run](https://travis-ci.org/rust-lang/rust/builds/333128237)
* [First Travis Run](https://travis-ci.org/rust-lang/rust/builds/332843472) 

Issues with no diagnosis/resolution

* None!

I'm sure this list will expand over time! I'll try to keep it updated.

Issues with a diagnosis/resolution that hasn't landed

* [x] i686 MSVC is showing a corrupt rlib when linking, something about archive writing changed maybe?
  * appears to be an [LLVM regression](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=36096)
  * local hack reverting the line in that linked commit seems to fix the issue
* [x] Emscripten needs an upgrade 
  * hopefully obviated by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/46819

Fixed issues:

* [x] LLVM [removed `CodeModel::Default`](https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/9aafb854c), it's now optional - #47710
* [x] The `MIPS64` archive variant [was renamed](https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/f45adc29de8aa80ac22b28ab421a92aaced80a97) - #47710
* [x] `UnsafeAlgebra` support [has been refactored](https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/00e900afd) - #47710
* [x] Return value of `writeArchive` [has changed](https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/203c90ba) - #47710
* [x] wasm32-unknown is showing `DICompileUnit` assertions, we probably need to apply the same fix that ThinLTO has already. - #47710
* [x] wasm32's dlmalloc needs updating as an intrinsic changed (there's an llvm5 branch in the dlmalloc repo)
* [x] Sanitizers need updating as x86_64-gnu is failing (compiler-builtins has an llvm6 branch)
* [x] Our FreeBSD x86_64 image fails to compile LLVM 6 - #47710
* [x] Lingering [debuginfo failure](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/47611) affects LLVM 5 as well - #47688
* [x] Our FreeBSD i686 image fails to compile LLVM - for now [hack around this](https://github.com/alexcrichton/llvm/commit/346b7d61b8a1dffc083245470ddd3120deda78a1)
* [x] arm-android has weird [floating point failures](https://travis-ci.org/rust-lang/rust/jobs/332843476) that suggests a compiler-rt mismatch
  * looks like this isn't caused by LLVM updates, but rather https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/compiler-builtins/pull/222
  * that'll get resolved by either backing it out or fixing it to land locally
  * fixed in https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/compiler-builtins/pull/224
* [x] x86_64/i686 linux dist builders can't compile newer compiler-rt (sanitizers presumably)
  * [random hack to fix this](https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-rt/commit/dfd960b5f1a1751b22738fa34fd27b583f4618db)

* [x] armhf-gnu has a few SIGSEGV in the test suite of run-fail, something about unwinding may be busted
  * appears to be an [LLVM regression](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=36073)
  * fix proposed at https://reviews.llvm.org/D42509

PRs:

* [x] ~~[Initial pass for upgrading in-tree support for LLVM 6](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/47681)~~
* [x] [First round of compat](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/47710)
* [x] [Fix DW_OP_deref support](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/47688) (affects LLVM 5 as well)
